item.description:
We will be hiking up Mt. Major via the main trail. This trail is 2.4 miles long one way and should take us approximately 1:30 to reach the summit. Upon reaching the summit we, we will double back and take the Major/Straightback link over to Straightback mountain. This would add approximately an additional 3 miles round trip to the hike. Therefore total distance would be approximately 7.8 miles and should take approximately 6 hours to accomplish.

In my opinion, Mt. Major offers some of the best views for a minimum smount of hiking.

Even though this is a relatively low elevation mountain, expect to encounter cold weather conditions. Dress appropriately!! Snowshoes are generally not required, since this is a often used trail. Foot traction devices are required. When we did this trail earlier this month, we encountered quite a bit of ice and frozen snow.

I am rating this a medium hike due to it being done in December. This is a great hike for individuals that enjoy three season hiking and would get a cold weather hike in.

Trailhead: Parking lot is on the left hand side or Route 11 just 4.2 miles north of the town of Alton Bay. There is a sign on route 11.
item.how_to_find_us: Dianne and I will be in a black four door Toyota Echo with Maine License plates
item.name: MT. MAJOR
